      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Record<E> Record.action(E action)
      The next state in the state machine.
      Record<E> Record.finishOnKey(java.lang.String key)
      The 'finishOnKey' attribute lets you choose a set of digits that end the recording when entered.
      Record<E> Record.finishOnKeyEight()
      Convenience function that does the same as finishOnKey("8").
      Record<E> Record.finishOnKeyFive()
      Convenience function that does the same as finishOnKey("5").

      Convenience function that does the same as finishOnKey("4").
      Record<E> Record.finishOnKeyHash()
      Convenience function that does the same as finishOnKey("#").
      Record<E> Record.finishOnKeyNine()
      Convenience function that does the same as finishOnKey("9").
      Record<E> Record.finishOnKeyOne()
      Convenience function that does the same as finishOnKey("1").

      Convenience function that does the same as finishOnKey("7").

      Convenience function that does the same as finishOnKey("6").

      Convenience function that does the same as finishOnKey("*").
      Record<E> Record.finishOnKeyThree()
      Convenience function that does the same as finishOnKey("3").
      Record<E> Record.finishOnKeyTwo()
      Convenience function that does the same as finishOnKey("2").
      Record<E> Record.finishOnKeyZero()
      Convenience function that does the same as finishOnKey("0").
      Record<E> Record.maxLength(int secondsToRecord)
      The 'maxLength' attribute lets you set the maximum length for the recording in seconds.
      Record<E> Record.method(Method method)
      The 'method' attribute takes the value 'GET' or 'POST'.
      Record<E> Record.methodGET()
      Convenience method that does the same as method(Method.GET).
      Record<E> Record.methodPOST()
      Convenience method that does the same as method(Method.POST).
      Record<E> Record.playBeep(boolean doPlayBeep)
      The 'playBeep' attribute allows you to toggle between playing a sound before the start of a recording.
      Record<E> DeclarativeComposer.record()
      Inserts a Record verb into your TwiML.
      Record<E> Record.timeout(int secondsOfSilence)
      The 'timeout' attribute tells Twilio to end the recording after a number of seconds of silence has passed.
      Record<E> Record.transcribe(boolean doTranscription)
      The 'transcribe' attribute tells Twilio that you would like a text representation of the audio of the recording.
      Record<E> Record.transcribeCallback(E transcribeCallback)
      A callback state in the state machine.
